medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive fatigue, muscle weakness, and bone pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began abruptly at age 37 with profound fatigue and bone pain, starting from the bottom of her right foot and quickly spreading to both feet and then to the whole body within a month. The pain intensified in severity and persisted. Despite medical therapy, symptoms evolved to include rib and pelvic fractures while some diagnoses, including conversion disorder, were assigned initially.
medical_history.past_medical_history: A rare disorder diagnosed as tumor-induced osteomalacia (TIO) nearly 20 years ago. Previous treatments included oral phosphorus and calcitriol, which eventually improved her symptoms. Long-term therapy has resulted in complications such as nephrolithiasis and tertiary hyperparathyroidism.
medical_history.family_history: No relevant family history; her sons and siblings are reported to be healthy with normal height and normal blood phosphorus levels.
